website_summaries.verdict: Samsung's Galaxy Note 5 is excellent overall, and the only phone to buy if you want to write by hand. However, you'll pay a huge premium for a modest upgrade from last year's model, and less pricey competitors will satisfy many.
pros: The Samsung Galaxy Note 5 has an eye-catching design and high-end hardware, and it takes great outdoor photos
Using the stylus has never felt better and battery life is terrific
cons: With a nonremovable battery and no external storage option, the Note 5 strips away some of last year's features
It's pricey compared with large-screen competitors like Motorola's Moto X Pure

customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2016 and didn't do as much reviews as I should've and purchased the phone's international version which didn't allow me to make calls, would drop calls, or just won't ring, and no external storage also sucked. Also,, video calling didn't work. I thought it was my phone service, but it worked on my brother and father's phone Other than that, the phone arrived real and new with all it's components.

customer_reviews.title: No SD Card support, No removable battery = NO BUY
customer_reviews.text: I've been user of the all the Note series phones/phablets... a pitty they decided to remove SD Card support and removable battery, a feature that makes this phone a no no. Sad that samsung emulates the bad things of iPhone et al. Bye bye Samsung :'( Will have to look for other android phones, or simply wait for Note 6... buy maybe they won't undo this awful decision on the Note 6 and decide even to add an Apple image to the back. If they are smart, they will release SOON a Note 5C (classic) with Note4 body, cover, battery, SD Card.
customer_reviews.author: agm

product_meta.title: Samsung Note 5 Unlocked Sprint/GSM, Gold, 32GB
product_meta.description: The Galaxy Note 5 it's still as big but now slimmer, framed by sleek metal and glass. Designed to keep up with your busy life.
feature_bullets: 5.7-inch Super AMOLED Capacitive Multi-Touchscreen (stylus pen included)
Android v5.1.1 (Lollipop), Quad-Core 1.5 GHz Cortex-A53 & Quad-Core 2.1 GHz Cortex-A57 Processor, Chipset: Exynos 742, Mali-T760MP8 Graphics
16 Megapixel Camera (5312 x 2988 pixels) w/ Optical Image Stabilization, Autofocus, LED flash + Front-facing 5 Megapixel Camera w/ Optical Stabilization
